sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Stemma sacrum, the royal progeny delineated, and with some notes explained, shewing His Sacred Majesties royal and lawful descent to his crown and kingdoms, from all the kings that ever reigned in this nation. / By Giles Fleming, rector of Waddingworth, in the diocess and county of Lincoln. Fleming, Giles, d. 1665.
[14], 48 p. : geneal. table (folded).
Printed for Robert Gibbs, at the golden Ball in Chancery-lane., London, : 1660.
First ed. Cf. BM. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Fleming, Giles, d. 1665.
[14], 48 p. : geneal. table (folded).
Printed for Robert Gibbs, at the golden Ball in Chancery-lane., London, : 1660.
First ed. Cf. BM. Annotation on Thomason copy: "July". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

the golden Ball in Chancery-lane.
